title: Vector Representation
text: Since the function has an input that is denoted as three dimensional from the $$R^3$$, it means that the $$x$$ vector has three components.

title: Distance
text: To find the distance between two vectors, subtract the corresponding components and square their difference. Then, take the square root of the sum of all the squared component differences.

title: Function Variables
text: The function will be written in terms of the components of $$x$$ (x_1 , $$x_2$$ , and x_3), which are kept as variables. Treat the components of the $$x$$ vector as if they were numerals when plugging into the distance formula.

title: Dimension of a Line
text: Since a line is one dimensional, it means that the vector representation only has one variable component, and the other two are determined in the problem.
